content.description:
Climb the crimpy arête at the entrance of the cave. Very sustained for such a short route. Hard for the grade.


The bolted arete on the left when looking at the cave.
bolts, bolted anchor

climbs.name: Aragorn's Arete
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Dom Caron, September 2021

content.description:
Beautiful climb on high quality stone. Step onto the face and traverse right across a narrow ledge. Move slightly up and right toward a bolt. Clip the bolt and continue up and right to a stance. From here resist the urge to move up to a pine tree and instead make a horizontal traverse right through better movement and gear until you reach the arete.  Follow the arete to the top of the block.



Start on the left side of Gollum’s Cave on the left edge of a slabby face. 

Standard Welsford rack. One protection bolt. Bolted anchor.

climbs.name: Forearmir
climbs.fa: Caleb Mazurkiewicz, Simon Bertheleme, Brooke Ashley and Dom Caron

content.description:
Unique climbing and bouldery moves through tiered roofs brings you to a crux. Decipher the crux and get rewarded with better holds to the top clipping the last bolt of leviathan on the way. Finish on leviathan anchors. 

It is recommended to back clean draw one after clipping draw two.This will reduce wear on your rope when lowering



Located at golems cave between pursuit of happiness and leviathan. 


Stick clip. 4 bolts (2 are perma-draws and 1 is shared with leviathan) shares anchor with leviathan. Alternative finish, continue up Aragorn’s Arete (trad ~5.9ish) all the way to the top.

Starting just inside the cave, climb the wall on the right by following a crack past a block. Continue by stemming with your back on the backwall and exit the cave to the right. From the ledge, link up with Reindeer Land. This route is 5.9 if you don't use the backwall in the cave.
Variation: The original route was done in 2 pitches and headed right on easy terrain from the ledge after the cave.

Cams and Nuts - No anchor at the top (traverse right for a third pitch to reach an anchor)

an alternative start to Reindeer Land. Climb the roof via the hand crack to gain the ledge of Reindeer Land.

standard rack

Adventure climb up the gully, aiming for a face with a bolt. Tricky moves before and after clipping the bolt.

The gully up and left of Gollem's cave and just to the right of Kit-Kat
standard rack. one bolt

Climb a blocky corner to a wide ledge.

up and left of Gollem's Cave
standard rack

This is a classic route. Leviathan climbs the bolted totem like feature around cave area. The first few moves are a bit height dependent but many betas can be used whether you are short or tall. Reminiscent of a V3 Boulder problem. This is one of the only routes in the Welsford area that will stay dry even in a downpour. The obvious bolted route at the cave area. 3 bolts and quick clip anchors.

Consider stick-clipping.

Stick clip the lone bolt. Start down and left under the roof. Climb up to the lip of the roof and make a boulder traverse right until you can pull up onto the wall above. Most people end at a tree part way up the dirty slab.

Basically a fun V4-5 boulder problem to easier climbing on gear.


this route climbs on the low roof located just left of the cave
1 bolt and a few small-medium cams

Climb a short blocky face to gain a ledge. Walk left along the ledge until you can step across the gap and climb the pleasant slab ending on top of the Roadrunner block.

Right and uphill from the cave, just right of the roof.
standard rack

Who doesn't like 5 easy trad. Good rock, lots of gear in a nice long pitch. Fantastic view of the Welsford Valley from the ledge on top. This line merges with the historic second pitch of Gollum's Cave. 



The start is just right of Reindeer Land. Follow a virtual plump line to a ledge at the top. 


Bolted anchor. Standard rack to #3. Rap the route or walk off to the northwest. You can get back down with a 60 meter rope but be sure to tie knots. You may have to move slightly right (uphill) to make the rope reach the ground.

Up and left from the cave, step onto the slab just left of where the low roofs end. Climb up and right, loosely following a right facing corner that turns to a small roof feature. Continue up past a ledge and join the arête that leads to the roadrunner block.

The start doesn't offer much gear (bring small cams) and at the time of writing the climb is quite dirty.


standard rack

Climb the thinner roof crack to the right of Ian's Overhang. Usually climbed as an alternative start to Reindeer Land

standard rack
Cave area is mostly a Trad area but has two classic bolted bouldery routes. Routes inside the cave will stay dry if it's raining but will seep in a downpour.
